definitions: having the opposite nature, direction, or meaning from something else
relating to or characteristic of informal spoken communication between people
examples: The converse relationship between price and demand is fundamental
His converse opinion challenged the prevailing view
Their converse manner made everyone feel comfortable
The converse style of the interview was refreshing

definitions: capable of being changed or transformed into a different form or use
describing a car with a roof that can be folded down or removed
examples: These convertible bonds can be exchanged for common stock
The convertible currency facilitated international trade
She drove her red convertible along the coastal highway
The convertible top was down on this sunny day

definitions: having an outline or surface that curves outward like the exterior of a sphere
examples: The convex lens magnified the tiny text clearly
A convex mirror provides a wider field of view

definitions: completely certain about something based on evidence or argument
having been successfully persuaded to believe or accept something as true
examples: She remained convinced that her decision was right
The jury was convinced of his innocence
After seeing the data, he became convinced of the need for change
They were finally convinced by the compelling arguments

definitions: capable of causing someone to believe that something is true or real
appearing authentic or credible enough to be accepted as genuine
examples: Her convincing presentation won over the skeptical investors
The lawyer made a convincing case for the defense
His convincing performance earned him the leading role
The replica was so convincing that experts were fooled

definitions: extremely complex and difficult to follow or understand due to intricacy
twisted or coiled in an intricate way, especially in biological structures
examples: The convoluted plot made the novel hard to follow
His convoluted explanation only confused matters further
The convoluted tubes of the kidney filter blood
Brain tissue shows convoluted folds and ridges

definitions: having been prepared for eating by applying heat through various methods
dishonestly altered or falsified, especially referring to accounts or records
examples: The cooked vegetables retained their bright colors
Properly cooked meat should reach safe internal temperatures
The cooked books hid millions in fraudulent transactions
These cooked statistics don't reflect reality

definitions: having a fairly low temperature that feels pleasant or refreshing
fashionable, impressive, or excellent in a way that attracts admiration
showing no anxiety or excitement; remaining calm under pressure
lacking warmth or enthusiasm in manner; somewhat unfriendly or distant
examples: The cool breeze provided relief from the heat
Store wine in a cool, dark place
That's a really cool jacket you're wearing
The new smartphone has some cool features
She remained cool during the emergency situation
His cool response prevented the conflict from escalating
Her cool reception made him feel unwelcome
Relations between them have been cool lately

definitions: willing to work together with others and help achieve shared goals
owned and operated jointly by members who share in benefits and profits
examples: The cooperative students made group projects run smoothly
She was very cooperative during the investigation
The farmers formed a cooperative to market their produce
Members of the housing cooperative share maintenance duties

definitions: having equal importance, rank, or degree within a system or structure
designed to match or complement each other in style, color, or pattern
examples: The coordinate branches of government maintain checks and balances
These coordinate clauses are joined by conjunctions
She wore coordinate accessories with her outfit
The coordinate bedding matched the curtains perfectly

definitions: organized or arranged so that different elements work together effectively
having the ability to use different parts of the body together smoothly
examples: The coordinated rescue effort saved many lives
A coordinated marketing campaign boosted sales significantly
The gymnast's coordinated movements impressed the judges
Well coordinated children excel at sports

definitions: serving to organize different elements to work together effectively or harmoniously
examples: The coordinating committee managed the entire event
A coordinating conjunction joins independent clauses

definitions: relating to an elegant eighteenth-century English furniture style characterized by graceful lines
examples: The chippendale chairs added elegance to the dining room
Authentic chippendale furniture commands high prices at auction

definitions: relating to or professing Christianity or its teachings and beliefs
showing qualities associated with Christian teachings such as kindness and charity
examples: Christian churches celebrate Easter as a major holiday
The christian community provides support to members
That was a very christian gesture of forgiveness
Her christian charity helped many families

definitions: relating to the theological study of the nature and work of Jesus Christ
examples: The christological debates shaped early church doctrine
Her dissertation examined christological themes in medieval art

definitions: very dark or gloomy, suggesting the mythical land of perpetual darkness
examples: The cimmerian depths of the cave terrified explorers
A cimmerian gloom settled over the abandoned mansion

definitions: relating to the dialect or culture of traditional working-class Londoners, especially East Enders
examples: His cockney accent revealed his East London origins
The cockney rhyming slang confused American tourists

definitions: abundant in supply or quantity; plentiful enough to be more than adequate
examples: She took copious notes during the important lecture
The storm brought copious amounts of much-needed rain

definitions: having the reddish-brown color or metallic sheen characteristic of copper
examples: Her coppery hair gleamed in the afternoon sunlight
The sunset painted the sky in coppery tones

definitions: protected by copyright law from unauthorized reproduction or use by others
examples: The copyrighted material cannot be used without permission
All copyrighted songs require licensing for commercial use

definitions: having a pinkish-orange color like that of red coral
made from or containing the hard skeletal material of marine coral
examples: She wore a beautiful coral dress to the party
The coral lipstick complemented her skin tone perfectly
The coral necklace was a family heirloom
Coral jewelry has been prized for centuries

definitions: bound, decorated, or equipped with cords or rope-like material
having prominent veins or sinews visible beneath the skin like cords
examples: The corded trim added texture to the upholstery
She wore a corded silk jacket to the event
His corded neck muscles showed years of physical labor
The athlete's corded arms revealed intense training

definitions: warm and friendly in manner, showing sincere affection or kindness
examples: The host gave us a cordial welcome at the door
Their cordial relationship made working together pleasant

definitions: operating on battery power without requiring a cord connected to electrical outlet
examples: The cordless phone allowed her to walk around while talking
Cordless tools make construction work more flexible

definitions: having the light, elastic texture or appearance characteristic of cork material
examples: The corky bark protects the tree from forest fires
Wine with a corky taste should be returned

definitions: relating to or affecting the transparent front layer of the eye
examples: The corneal transplant restored his vision completely
Corneal abrasions can be extremely painful

definitions: preserved or cured with salt or brine, especially referring to beef
examples: Corned beef and cabbage is a traditional Irish-American dish
The deli serves excellent corned beef sandwiches

definitions: having a specified number or type of corners or angles
forced into a position from which escape is difficult or impossible
examples: The three-cornered hat was fashionable in colonial times
A four-cornered contest made the election unpredictable
The cornered animal became dangerously aggressive
She felt cornered by their persistent questions

definitions: trite, banal, or mawkishly sentimental in an old-fashioned way
examples: His corny jokes made everyone groan at dinner
The movie's corny dialogue ruined an otherwise good plot

definitions: relating to the arteries that supply blood to the heart muscle
examples: Coronary artery disease is a leading cause of death
The patient underwent coronary bypass surgery

definitions: relating to or affecting the human body rather than the spirit
examples: Corporal punishment has been banned in many schools
The monks practiced corporal mortification

definitions: relating to a large business corporation or group of companies
involving united action by members of a group sharing common purpose
examples: Corporate profits reached record levels this quarter
The corporate headquarters moved to a new city
They made a corporate decision to restructure
Corporate responsibility requires considering all stakeholders

definitions: having a physical material body rather than being spiritual or immaterial
examples: Ghosts lack corporeal form according to most beliefs
The corporeal world contrasts with spiritual realms

definitions: free from errors or mistakes; accurate in accordance with fact or truth
conforming to accepted social standards of proper behavior or manners
examples: The correct answer earned her full marks
Please provide the correct spelling of your name
Her correct posture impressed the dance instructor
Correct etiquette is essential at formal dinners

definitions: having been made accurate or right by removing errors or mistakes
adjusted or compensated to account for known errors or distortions
examples: The corrected manuscript was ready for publication
Students submitted their corrected homework assignments
The corrected vision allowed her to see clearly
Corrected coordinates led them to the right location

definitions: relating to the treatment and rehabilitation of criminal offenders in custody
examples: The correctional facility houses minimum security inmates
Correctional officers maintain order in the prison

definitions: designed to correct or counteract something harmful or undesirable
examples: Corrective lenses helped improve his vision significantly
The company took corrective action after the scandal

definitions: having a mutual relationship or connection where one affects or depends on another
examples: These correlate factors influence the final outcome
Correlate variables must be analyzed together

definitions: having a mutual relationship where changes in one correspond to changes in another
examples: Income and education levels are strongly correlated
These correlated symptoms suggest a common cause

definitions: having a mutual or reciprocal relationship; corresponding to each other
examples: Rights and duties are correlative concepts in law
The correlative conjunctions work in pairs

definitions: similar, analogous, or having the same relationship or relative position
examples: The correspondent figures in both triangles are equal
Their correspondent duties required similar skills

definitions: having a similar position, purpose, or relationship in different situations
examples: The corresponding chapter in the new edition covers similar topics
Sales increased with a corresponding rise in profits

definitions: gradually destroyed or worn away by chemical action, especially oxidation
examples: The corroded pipes needed immediate replacement
Corroded battery terminals prevented the car from starting

definitions: having the ability to gradually destroy or damage metal or other materials through chemical action
having a harmful or destructive effect on something, especially relationships or morale
examples: Store corrosive chemicals in specially designed containers
The corrosive acid ate through the metal quickly
His corrosive criticism destroyed team morale
Corrosive cynicism undermined their enthusiasm

definitions: shaped into alternate ridges and grooves for added strength or flexibility
examples: The corrugated cardboard provided excellent protection for shipping
Corrugated iron roofs are common in rural areas

definitions: willing to act dishonestly for money or personal gain, especially in public office
containing errors or alterations that prevent proper operation or use
examples: The corrupt officials were arrested for taking bribes
A corrupt police force cannot maintain public trust
The corrupt file could not be opened properly
Corrupt data caused the system to crash

definitions: made morally depraved or willing to act dishonestly through negative influence
changed from original state through damage, decay, or unauthorized alteration
examples: Power had corrupted his once noble intentions
The corrupted judge accepted bribes regularly
The corrupted files could not be recovered
Corrupted memory caused frequent system crashes

definitions: having a harmful effect on morals or integrity; tending to cause dishonesty
examples: The corrupting influence of easy money was evident
They worried about television's corrupting effect on children

definitions: relating to the outer layer of an organ, especially the brain's cerebral cortex
examples: Cortical damage affected his speech abilities
The cortical regions control higher brain functions

definitions: designed to improve appearance rather than function or health
affecting only the appearance rather than addressing underlying problems
examples: She underwent cosmetic surgery to reshape her nose
The cosmetic improvements made the house more attractive
The reforms were merely cosmetic and changed nothing fundamental
These cosmetic changes won't solve the real problems
